turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Vy Gjøvikbanen.
turn.1: What are the main routes of the Vy Gj ⁇ vikbanen?
turn.2: The initial plans launched in 2002 called for three routes to be subject to PSO: the Gjøvik Line, the Bratsberg Line and the Bergen Commuter Rail.
turn.4: These are the commuter train services least passengers, and the purpose was to use the initial tenders as a "learning exercise" and to create a more efficient system to implement in future tenders.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: The plans also called for transferring the responsibility for managing and financing the PSO contracts on commuter rail services to the counties, but this was not followed, in part because of a report from the Institute of Transport Economics, which concluded that this would provide a worse service.
turn.8: At the time, the government was spending NOK 1.4 billion annually on purchasing passenger transport from NSB.
turn.9: Is the government still spending that money?
turn.10: By introducing PSO, Skogsholm stated that she hoped the costs would be reduced, and that quality and safety levels would remain, or even improve.
turn.12: The counties have been allowed to issue PSO contracts on bus transport since 1994; and Skogsholm saw the competition in rail transport as a continuation of this.
